ratings.comment: Really great professor. He's really smart, friendly, funny, and knows how to teach. I would definitely recommend him.
LOVES to hear himself talk.  He is a strict grader.  Don't take him.
He was good at explaining concepts and teaching.  His tests were hard and time intensive, but the curve smoothed it out.  He only took the highest grades for quizzes and tests.

He enjoys telling you one thing while expecting another. Doesn't use the book at all... cites topics that we haven't covered yet. Shoots you down for offering a way to do the proofs he can't figure out. Basically he's the definition of an ignoramus/****. Grades are almost as incomprehensible as he is. The UW should fire him!
Tests are very hard, but the class is graded fairly.  He is good with answering questions and has a dry sense of humor, good professor

I switched from another professor to his class and the difference was remarkable. He taught in a structured format, had tests that really reflected what was taught in class and was always very helpful. A+!

I found Adrian hard to follow in lecture bc he goes pretty fast. During OH, he explained material well & I actually understood it. His quizes pretty easy, but exams really hard. No matter how much I studied and thought I knew material, I still got tons of points off. No credit for homework. Not bad as a prof, but Math 222 is a hard class in general

Adrian is awesome.  His lectures are sometimes dry, but he takes time to explain the material and will actually answer your questions.  He's also very understandable (he's Romanian) and makes himself available if you need to talk to him.

I'm pretty sure Adrian is Romanian (his accent sounds kind of australian) but he is very easy to understand and has a dry sense of humor. In short, good teacher, grading is easy, and for MATH 222, was as simple as someone could make it.

Math 222 is going to be hard no matter what professor you have.  Tudorascu was about as good as it gets.  Very willing to help you.  The exams only have 5 questions, but they are VERY hard. You only have to answer 4 questions and a 35 out of 40 is a perfect score, so its possible to get better than 100 percent. I recommend Tudorascu for 222.

He did a good job in explaining the material.  Overall, i would say he is highly effective.  Make sure you know your stuff prior to the exam, because the material just keeps building up on itself (seriously, how many ways can you interpret 3 equations?)

Very easy for a calculus class.  I never went to lecture and am still getting a solid A.   You have to do 4 out of 5 problems on an exam and get 35/40 points for a perfect score.  I thought his lectures were a bit too dry and he always did exactly what was in the book.  Do the homework, go to discussion, do the practice exams.. and you will be fine

Good, but can get most of the same information by just reading the book and not going to class.  I liked that you only had to answer 4 out of 5 questions on the exams and it was possible to get over 100%

Tudorascu isn't easy, but he really wants his students to do well, and I really enjoyed his style.  His lectures actually made me laugh (dry sense of humor), and he does a good job explaining how he works each problem so that you understand the rationale behind each step.  I still relied on the book a lot, but the lectures were a good complement.

Prof. Tudorascu pretty much follows the ideas in the book, but I still would recommend lectures because they are much easier to follow than the book.  His tests are hard, but if you studying the problems in the book and MEMORIZE the practice test an A is in easy reach!  I left the class with a great understanding of basic calculus.
